summary: There were 81 fatal violent extremist attacks in the United States from 2010 through 2020, resulting in 240 deaths, according to an academic database that tracks extremist crime. We reviewed the Department of Homeland Security's strategy for preventing targeted violence and terrorism, including its efforts to counter violent extremism. DHS's strategy didn't include all 7 elements of a successful strategy, such as a resource assessment...
title: Countering Violent Extremism: DHS Can Further Enhance Its Strategic Planning and Data Governance Efforts
